content.description:
Follow a crack up and over a bulge to a slab. Shares a start with Hoveland Arete but trends right at the midpoint.

Starts at the bottom of the most pronounced crack on the left side of the wall. 
Two hangars with rings at top. A #2 or #3 Camalot for the bottom crack and then 6 bolts to the top.

Follow a short steep corner up to a bolt and on to a roof. Finish on the same anchors as Hovland arete.

Start at the base of a tree on the furthest left portion of the wall.
Two hangars with rings at top. A  #2 or #3 Camalot for the bottom crack and a meduim nut or .4 Camalot for the roof to reduce small run outs.

Follow a crack up and over a bulge to a bolted slab. Continue on up through a small roof to arete to the anchor. Shares a start with Gary's Route but trends left at the midpoint.

Starts at the bottom of the most pronounced crack on the left side of the wall.
Two hangars with rings at top. #2 or #3 Camalot for the bottom crack and a meduim nut or .4 Camalot for the roof to reduce small run outs.

Climb up to a crack through a steep bulge. Make awkward move up and right to a short section of slab and finish up long easy crack above.

Start at the bottom of the long crack that slopes to the left at the right end of the wall.
Two hangars with rings at top. A full single rack of cams can be used to adequately protect the climb, though doubles in 1 and 2 could be used if you really wanted to zip it up.

Fun mix of crack climbing and slab all in one place. All climbs can be top roped via a trail found between "Main Wall" and "Lone Route Wall'. This wall is separated into two distinct parts by a short trail. This section is for the portion of the wall found just a short walk further down the path.
